source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Gnaphalium
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1999). Gnaphalium. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves linear, under 1.5 mm wide; capitula in terminal clusters, usually overtopped by the subtending floral leaves; entire plant rarely exceeding 6 cm in height
Leaves oblanceolate or obovate, at least 2 mm wide; capitula spicately or racemosely arranged, not overtopped by subtending leaves at anthesis (but sometimes in bud); plants usually higher than 8 cm
